intro: Dryandra mutica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in heathlands and woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
